Employee Group Personal Accident Policy Features_2025-2026.pdf

__data__.text:
2
*Accident - means a sudden, unforeseen, uncontrollable and unexpected physical event to the insured person caused by external, violent and visible means occurring under
the circumstances described in a hazard applicable to that person.
     Cover is available 24/7, across the world 
                     Age Limit: 18 years to 65 years
 Cover for Employee, Spouse and children
GPA BENEFITS MANUAL 2025-26 
Insurer Name –  Aditya Birla Health Insurance Co. Limited
Broker Name – Policy Bazaar Broking
Policy Period – 21 Feb 2025 – 20 Feb 2026
Group Personal Accident (GPA): Scope of Cover
▪ This policy is purely an accident*instigated policy
▪ It covers the financial risk due to death, disability and loss of earnings 
caused due to an accident*
▪ It reduces the financial burden on the family as a whole due to loss of 
earning

Employee Group Personal Accident Policy Features_2025-2026.pdf

__data__.text:
2
Capital Benefits
Employee Sum Insured
The policy provides coverage equal to 2 times the Annual Fixed CTC, with a minimum coverage of INR 15 lakhs and a 
maximum of INR 2 crores. The maximum sum assured is capped according to each career level. The detailed Sum 
Assured for each career level is provided below.
Career Level Capping of Sum Assured
VP & Above 2,00,00,000 
AVP Band1 1,50,00,000 
AVP Band2 1,20,00,000 
Sr. Managers 1,00,00,000 
AM & Mgr 75,00,000 
Sr. Executives 50,00,000 
Executives 30,00,000 
Officer 15,00,000
GPA BENEFITS MANUAL 2025-26 
Spouse & Child Cover
For Employees’ Spouse & Children: Coverage  is 10% of employees’ sum insured.
Spouse and children are covered for Accidental Death, Dismemberment,  Permanent Total Disability, and Permanent Partial Disability.

metadata.file_name: Employee Group Personal Accident Policy Features_2025-2026.pdf
Employee Group Personal Accident Policy Features_2025-2026.pdf

__data__.text:
2
Accidental Death 
Compensation is payable in case of accidental death. In such 
a loss 100% of the sum insured is paid up to 2 crores..
Permanent Partial Disability (PPD)
Means the Insured person has suffered a permanent loss of 
physical function or anatomical loss of use of a body part, 
substantiated by a diagnosis from a physician. In such a 
situation 200% of the sum insured is payable.
* *scale of disability is as per the insurer's product filed with IRDA & refer 
the table of losses for PPD
GPA Benefits
Accidental Dismemberment
▪ Compensation is payable if the accident results in the loss 
of two limbs or two eyes or one limb &/or one eye or loss 
of speech & loss of hearing in one or both ears. The % 
benefit given depends on the degree of loss
▪ In case of dismemberment, the amount payable is in 
double the % value to the sum insured to pay for 
disability and higher living care expenses
▪ Refer the table of losses for Accidental Dismemberment.
GPA BENEFITS MANUAL 2025-26 
Permanent Total Disability (PTD)
Permanent* Total Disability - means total and permanent 
inability to engage in each and every occupation or employment 
for compensation or profit for which you are reasonably qualified 
by education, training, or experience for the rest of your life.
*Permanent - means lasting twelve calendar months and at the 
expiry of that period being beyond reasonable hope of 
improvement.
Compensation is payable if Permanent Total Disablement is 
caused due to an accident. In such a situation 200% of the 
sum insured is payable to pay for higher living expenses
Temporary Total Disability
 A weekly payment of up to 1% of sum insured is up to INR 
100,000 or as per the actual net weekly salary (whichever is 
lower) is given for each week up to a maximum of 104 weeks.
This is a loss of pay benefit due to accident for the days that you 
are hospitalized or recovering at home by taking leave (paid / 
un-paid)

metadata.file_name: Employee Group Personal Accident Policy Features_2025-2026.pdf
Employee Group Personal Accident Policy Features_2025-2026.pdf

__data__.text:
2
Other GPA Benefits
Medical Expenses 
Medical expenses reimbursement up to Rs. 100,000 or actual claims as In-patient hospitalization (24 hours hospitalization required) and 
Rs. 50,000 as OPD or actual claim whichever is lower.
Facial Scarring and Dental reconstruction
Cover up to INR 100,000 in case of accidents
GPA BENEFITS MANUAL 2025-26 
Burns Cover
In case of burns, claim towards the medical expense incurred both on in-patient and out-patient would be reimbursed up to maximum of 
INR 100,000.
Accidental Dental Expenses
In case of damage to teeth due to accident claim towards the medical expense incurred both on in-patient and out-patient would be 
reimbursed up to maximum of INR 50,000.
Broken Bones cover
In case of broken bones to accident claim towards the medical expense incurred both on in-patient and out-patient would be reimbursed 
up to maximum of INR 50,000.

metadata.file_name: Employee Group Personal Accident Policy Features_2025-2026.pdf
Employee Group Personal Accident Policy Features_2025-2026.pdf

__data__.text:
2
Other GPA Benefits
Air Ambulance Cover
In case of an accident, claim towards the services of air 
ambulance required for the insured employee for medical 
evacuation to a hospital for his treatment would be reimbursed 
up to a maximum of INR 50,000.
Ambulance Cover
Ambulance expenses incurred in the transportation from 
accident site to hospital and from hospital to home is covered 
under the policy, subject to a maximum limit of INR 2,000 or 
actual bills whichever is lower.
GPA BENEFITS MANUAL 2025-26 
Family Transportation benefit 
Benefit coverage is up to INR 50,000
In case of an admissible claim for death, permanent total or 
permanent partial disablement under the policy, if the Insured 
person is confined in a hospital outside 100 kms of his normal 
place of residence, within 12 months from the date of accident, 
and the attending medical practitioner recommends the 
personal attendance of an immediate family member, Insurer 
will reimburse the expenses incurred for the immediate family 
member for transportation by the most direct route by a licensed 
common carrier to the place of confinement of the Insured 
person
Child Education Benefit
In case of accidental death, claim towards the higher 
education (+12th standard) expense would be reimbursed 
to the deceased person‘s dependant child up to a 
maximum of INR 100,000. 
This benefit shall be limited to a maximum of 2 children. It 
will be for a maximum of 4 years.

metadata.file_name: Employee Group Personal Accident Policy Features_2025-2026.pdf
Employee Group Personal Accident Policy Features_2025-2026.pdf

__data__.text:
2
Disability Support Items Cover
In case of accident, claim towards the expense incurred 
for wheelchair, walking aids, hearing and vision aids, 
artificial limbs, and prosthetics would be reimbursed up to 
a maximum of INR 100,000.
House and Vehicle Modification Benefit
In case of permanent total disablement which resulted from 
an accident and insured is required to modify his vehicle or 
make some changes in his house, insurer will reimburse 
such expenses up to a maximum of INR 100,000
Other GPA Benefits
Terrorism Cover
Any death or disability due to terrorism is covered.
Funeral Expenses 
In case of claim for accidental death, any expenses 
incurred for preparing body for burial or cremation is 
payable up to a maximum of INR 10,000
Repatriation Benefit
INR 50,000 or actual whichever is less for the 
transportation of the body to the house / native place of 
the insured.
GPA BENEFITS MANUAL 2025-26 
Trauma Counselling
New Cover for 2 sessions and covered up to INR 25,000
Loss of Employment cover (Due to 
disability caused by Accident)
Loss of Employment Cover (Due to disability caused by Accident) 
Covered up to INR 15,000 (one time payment)/Covered up to 3 
months salary or 5% of the PTD Or PPD Sum Assured up to 
maximum of INR 75,000
Cost of Supporting Items
Covered

__data__.text:
22
Exclusions
▪ War, invasion, acts of foreign enemies, hostilities (whether 
war be declared or not), civil war, commotion unrest, 
rebellion, revolution, insurrection, military or usurped power 
or confiscation or nationalisation or requisition of or damage 
or under the order of any government or public authority 
▪ Nuclear energy, radiation 
▪ Any existing disablement prior to the inception of the policy 
▪ Venereal or sexually transmitted diseases, HIV (Human 
Immunodeficiency Virus) or HIV related illness including 
AIDS (Acquired Immune Deficiency Syndrome) and/or 
mutant derivatives or variations however caused
▪ Any medical expenses, services, supplies or treatment or 
hospital stay which were not recommended or approved as 
medically necessary by a medical practitioner 
▪ Any expense incurred which is not exclusively medical in 
nature/unproven or experimental treatment of any 
description 
▪ Expenses incurred for emergency medical evacuation
▪ For standard list of excluded items refer policy wordings
▪ Intentional self injury (including but not limited to the use 
or misuse of any intoxicating drugs or alcohol) 
▪ Accident while under the influence of alcohol or drugs 
▪ Participation in an actual or attempted felony, riot, crime, 
misdemeanor or civil commotion 
▪ Any accident of which a contributing cause was the 
Insured person’s actual or attempted commission of, or 
willful participation in, an illegal act or any violation or 
attempted violation of the law or his resistance to arrest
▪ Whilst engaging in aviation or ballooning or whilst 
mounting into, dismounting from or traveling in any 
balloon or aircraft other than as passenger(fare paying or 
otherwise) in any duly licensed standard type of aircraft
▪ Participating in motor racing or trial run as a driver, co-
driver or passenger 
▪ Curative treatments or interventions that the Insured 
person carries out or have carried out on his body 
▪ Pregnancy and childbirth, miscarriage, abortion or 
complications arising out of any of these
GPA BENEFITS MANUAL 2025-26

approved 
within 30

assignee

1. What is Flexi Allowance Plan (FAP)? 
The FAP is a way in which you can tailor your benefits package to meet your individual requirements as well 
as saving tax or reduce tax outflow. 
2. Which are the components available in FAP and their eligibility limits?

__data__.text:
Page 4 of 15 
 
2. How do I claim my Flexi / CTC reimbursement? And when I will receive amount?  
 
You can submit your claims on Empower+ / Peoplestrong web portal and through mobile application any 
time in the month. Claims validation (Approval and rejecti on) done by our payroll vendor during 1st to 15th 
of the month.  
Deadline Submitted through Payment Timelines 
Last month 16th to Current 
month 15th of the month 
Empower+ / Peoplestrong web 
portal / Mobile application 
Consider in Current month 
payroll through Salary credit 
Claims submitted post 16th of 
current month 
Empower+ / Peoplestrong web 
portal / Mobile application 
Consider in Subsequent month 
payroll salary credit 
March of every year, claims 
will be accepted till 15th March 
Empower+ / Peoplestrong web 
portal / Mobile application Along with March salary credit 
  
Note: No claims will be entertained post 15 th March or post March salary credit for tax exemption purpose. 
Hence kindly submit the claims on regular and timely basis to get the credits and enjoy tax free ben efits. 
 
3. How will I get unclaimed amount which not claimed during the FY? 
 
We are doing year end flush out  in every March of respective financial year  for balance amount which is 
unclaimed or unutilized by employee . Flush out will be taxable in the hand of employee and tax will be 
deducted as per the income tax slab.  Employee who selected flexi pay from 1 Dec it will be calculated for 4 
month and for new joinee Flexi pay calculated from date of joining till 31 st March.  
 
Please refer below table for more understanding: 
Flexi Components YTD Eligibility Claimed during 
FY 
Taxable Flushout 
in March 
Personal Car Fuel Reimbursements 144,000 144,000 0 
Personal Car Fuel Reimbursements 144,000 80,000 64,000 
Vehicle Maintenance Reimbursement 60,000 60,000 0 
Vehicle Maintenance Reimbursement 60,000 30,000 30,000 
 
Incase employee exit during the financial year flexi pay eligibility will be calculated till last working day and 
unclaimed amount process along with full and final settlement as taxable.   
 
4. Can I change/remove my Flexi pay anytime or during FY ? 
 
No, you will not be able to change or remove any components once you selected your flexi pay. Employee 
will get option once to select the Flexi pay during the FY (i.e. effective from 1 st April / 1st Dec), new joinee 
Flexi pay will be consider from date of joining.

__data__.text:

5. How and when I will able to select or change flexi pay? 
Refer HR communication, once HR enable Flexi pay selection on Empower+ / Peoplestrong web portal you 
can able to restructure your CTC from portal. Flexi pay selection option not available on Mobile application  
New Joinee Existing Employee 
 (Effective 1st of Subsequent 
month from DOJ) 
FY Beginning 
(Effective 1st April) 
Effective 1st June / 
1st December 
 
6. What is “HRA”? 
 
“HRA” (House Rent Allowance) is the amount allocated towards the expenses of rent paid towards 
accommodation. As per our existing grade salary structure the amount will get allocated towards this 
component. This option is applicable for all  states except for Maharashtra & West Bengal for statutory 
reasons. HRA exemption is only applicable under old tax regime 
 
7. What is “Food / Meal Coupon”? 
 
“Food / Meal Coupon” is a 100% Tax Free Component under disposable income  in Old tax regime . If 
employee opted New Tax regime no exemption provided and consider as taxable income.  You may opt for 
Meal coupon as per your requirement & the chosen amount will be adjusted from your Supplementary 
allowance. You can select following meal coupon options: 
Tax Savings approx. (in INR) 
Amt. Per Annum 13200 26400 35640 
Amt. Per Month 1200 2400 2970 
Tax Slab  Savings 
5% 660 1320 1782 
20% 2640 5280 7128 
30% 3960 7920 10692 
 
Please note: 
a. In the event of leave without pay (LWP) the pro-rata amount will be recovered from the salary.  
b. In the event of exit: 
i. Meal coupon will not be disbursed during Notice Period. The same amount will be disbursed 
through salary in Full & Final Settlement.  
ii. If Meal coupons are already disbursed, then the pro-rata amount will be recovered through 
Full & Final settlement. 
 
8. How will I receive Meal Coupon every month? 
TALIC has moved to paperless with App (HAPPAY) based module for Meal Coupons. The amount reserved 
for Meal coupons shall be disbursed within 5 working days’ post salary processing to your Happay wallet. 
Post Remittance of Meal Coupons amount you will receive an EMAIL/SMS notification on your official mal 
id. 
The process for enrollment & activation on App is as follows:  
1. Once you have selected & submit Meal coupon under FAP, login to HAPPAY account. 
2. Contact your ZHR for update on HAPPAY Card.

metadata.file_name: Flexi Pay_FAQ _ Updated_01 April 2025.pdf
Flexi Pay_FAQ _ Updated_01 April 2025.pdf

__data__.text:
Page 6 of 15 
 
HAPPAY App is available on IOS/Android platform. 
Following are options to redeem your meal coupons on Food/Market outlets 
 User Guide for Happay App : Refer the help file available on Happay Login Help file-
Updated.pdf 
 
9. Where I can use these Meal Vouchers through HAPPAY and what are the key benefits? 
 
a. You can use the Meal vouchers at affiliated outlets through HAPPAY App, as well as at non-affiliated 
outlets by using HAPPAY Card. 
b. You can also receive offers in line by merchant if you are paying through HAPPAY.  
c. You can pay any amount which is not the case with paper base vouchers.  
d. Fully secured from Vouchers getting lost or destroyed unlike paper-based vouchers. 
e. Accepted in all food & Non -Alcoholic merchants in the entire food category which included 
(Supermarkets, Restaurants, Eatery Joints & all online food Aggregators & Grocery S tores) 
 
10. What is “Gift Coupon”? 
 
“Gift Coupon” is a 100% Tax Free Component as per Income Tax Rule up  to INR 5000. You may opt for this 
component which is fixed valued @ INR 5000 per annum & the same amount will be adjusted from your 
Supplementary allowance. In case an employee has received Gift voucher or reward (through R&R) over & 
above INR 5000 from the Company the amount over & above the prescribed limit will be taxable in the hands 
of employee and perquisite tax will be charged accordingly.  Non-completion of KYC as per guidelines gift 
coupon will be consider as taxable in March salary.  
 
As per IT rules any amount paid as gift  or any nature  above INR 5000/ - threshold will be consider as 
aggregated taxable income. Which includes redeemed cheers points, any gift such as Amazon vouchers, 
white goods, electric items etc. provided by TALIC will be consider as taxable perquisite.   
Available for selection: 
 
 For existing employees in April & June every year 
 For newly joined employees within 30 days of joining till the month before Diwali  
 
Please note : Full KYC of Flexi benefit availing employee on HAPPAY platform is must as per the RBI 
guidelines. In case the employee fails to complete the KYC he/she may not receive monthly benefit credits 
in to their Happay account.  
 
In the event of exit:  
a. Gift coupon will not be disbursed during Notice Period. The same amount will be disbursed 
through salary in Full & Final Settlement.  
b. If Gift coupons are already disbursed, then the pro-rata amount will be recovered  through Full 
& Final settlement. 
 
11. When & how the “Gift Coupons” will be disbursed to employees? 
 
Gift coupons will get disbursed during festival season like Diwali  (as per Company’s discretion) . Not 
applicable to opt in post November till March.

12. What is “Child Education allowance”? 
 
“Child Education allowance” is a 100% Tax Free Component  under old tax regime . You m ay opt for this 
component with an eligibility limit of INR 100 per month per child. Based on your selection, the same amount 
will be adjusted from your Supplementary allowance.  
 
Employee can select the Child Education Allowance in their FAP and same will be payable to employee on 
monthly basis in the payroll. Employee is required to submit “Self-Declaration” at the time of year end 
investment proof submission activity or at the time of Exit. In the event of mid-year exit or leave without 
pay, the same amount will be deducted on pro-rata basis. 
 
 
13. What is “Hostel allowance”? 
 
“Hostel allowance” is a 100% Tax Free Component under old tax regime . You may opt for this component 
with an eligibility limit of INR 300 per month per child. Based on your selection, the same amount will be 
adjusted from your Supplementary allowance.  
 
Employee can select the Hostel Allowance  in their FAP and same will be payable to employee on monthly 
basis in the payroll. Employee is required to submit “ Self-Declaration” at the time of year end investment 
proof submission activity or at the time of Exit. In the event of mid -year exit or leave without pay, the same 
amount will be deducted on pro-rata basis. 
 
14. What is “LTA”? 
 
“LTA” (Leave Travel Allowance) is a 100% Tax Free Component as per LTA Policy  under old tax regime. In 
case you have opted for the same (while you are eligible), it will be valued @ one month’s Basic Salary & the 
same amount will be adjusted from your Supplementary allowance. Employees can claim twice in a block of 
4 years & for the current period the block is Jan 2022 to Dec 2025. 
 
Note: Above options are applicable only for New Joiners & For existing employees it is available for changes only 
in every April. 
In case: 
Opted for LTA (as per eligibility):  
I. If LTA is claimed basis travel proofs submission as per LTA Policy & Income Tax regulations 
the amount reimbursed will be non-taxable income. 
II. If LTA is claimed without travel proofs submission the amount reimbursed will be taxable 
income (as per Income Tax Bracket). 
III. In case the LTA amount is not claimed then during the financial year then the same amount 
will be flushed out in March payroll post tax (as per Income Tax Bracket).  
 
Refer : Leave Travel Allowances- LTA policy.pdf on TALIC NET  
  
15. What is “Car Lease Rental”? 
 
Employees eligible for “Car Lease Benefit” and have opted for the same as per TALIC’s “Car Lease Policy” 
are eligible for this component. The amount allocated as “Car Lease Rental” is the monthly EMI agreed to be

17. “Fuel Reimbursements” as per Car Lease Policy? 
“Fuel Reimbursements” is a fixed amount defined under “Car Lease Policy” for reimbursements against Fuel 
expenses. This amount is reimbursed based on actuals (within the defined monthly eligibility) against Fuel 
bills. Employees availing “Personal Car Fuel Reimbursements” will not be eligible to claim local conveyance

In case the Fuel Reimbursements amount is claimed: Perquisite Tax based on the CC of car. 
The unclaimed amount is paid post Tax deduction on yearly basis. Please refer to “Car Lease  Policy”

18. What is “Driver’s Salary Reimbursements”? 
 
“Driver’s Salary Reimbursements” is a fixed amount defined under “Car Lease Policy” for reimbursements 
against Fuel expenses. This amount is reimbursed based on actuals (within the defined monthly eligibility) 
against Fuel bills.  
 
In case the Driver’s Salary Reimbursements amount is claimed: Perquisite Tax based on the CC of car.  
The unclaimed amount is paid post Tax deduction on yearly basis. Please refer to “Car Lease Policy”

21. What are the documentation & claim process for “Personal Car Fuel Reimbursements”?  
 
Employees option for Personal Car Fuel Reimbursements FAP are required to submit following documents 
to HR Services team through email.

 Self-attested car Registration Card copy (Self owned vehicle)   
 Insurance renewal copy (every year)

 Toll Receipts and Parking charges 
 OLA / UBER bills for office travels 
 
The unclaimed amount  is paid post Tax deduction on yearly basis. Please refer to “Personal Car Fuel 
Reimbursement Policy” respectively for more details on the claim. 
 
22. How do I claim fuel reimbursement and driver’s salary? 
TALIC has moved to the digital platform (paperless) us ing App (Empower+ / PeopleStrong) based module 
for Fuel and Driver salary. The amount reserved for fuel /driver salary  reimbursement shall be claimed by 
employees by uploading relevant bills / supporting documents on Empower+ / Peoplestrong Application / 
Portal throughout the month. Bills uploaded on or before 1st to 15th of every month will be considered for the 
current month payroll calculation . Bills uploaded post 16 th of the month will be considered for subsequent 
month payroll calculation. Post valida tion of bills the approved amount (as per eligibility limits) will be 
disbursed to employees bank account along with salary . In case if employee is not able to submit the valid 
documents, it will be released in the month of March with applying taxes.  
The process for enrollment & activation on App is as follows:  
1. Employee has to select & submit online application under car lease program through Leaseplan.  
2. This further follows approval process through HR. 
3. Basis the HR approval, the vendor procures & delivers the vehicle, then the car lease deductions are 
considered from subsequent months’ salary. 
4. Leaseplan / TATA Capital will intimate TALIC about start date of lease rental accordingly HR 
services team will inform employee and revise the pay structure  
5. Once the pay structure is uploaded and processed in payroll from subsequent month employee can 
start claiming Driver’s salary and Fuel reimbursement benefits.   
6. To claim the benefits, login to Empower+ / Peoplestrong app from App Store / Play Store. 
7. Please refer the PPT shared on TALICNET for activation of your account.  
8. Contact your ZHR for update on Empower+ / Peoplestrong application and portal details. 
Empower+ / Peoplestrong App is available on IOS/Android platform. 
The unclaimed amount is paid post Tax deduction on yearly basis.  
 
23. What is Vehicle Maintenance Reimbursement? 
 
Vehicle maintenance reimbursement is given to employees to claim their vehicle maintenance and avail the 
tax benefits under the business expenses. This component will be allowed only for employees who have 
opted for Car Lease program or Personal Car Fuel R eimbursements. Following are the limits to claim the 
vehicle maintenance reimbursement.

to submit the valid documents, it will be released in the month of March with applying taxes.  
 
25. What is “Superannuation”? 
 
The Superannuation is a retirement benefit plan designed to provide financial security to the employee post-
retirement. All on-roll employees of Tata AIA Life Insurance Co. Ltd. who hold the position of Manager and 
above are eligible to enroll in the Superannuation Scheme. The annual contribution rate i s 15% of the basic

This amount is 100% Tax exempted. Superannuation being a Pension scheme it cannot be withdrawn as per 
the Terms & Conditions of the Policy. For more details, please refer to “Superannuation Policy”.  
 
26. What are the tax benefits of Superannuation?   
 
Superannuation offers significant tax benefits, as employer contributions to the Superannuation Scheme are 
considered employer contributions, reducing the employee's gross taxable income. Under both the old and 
new tax regimes, contributions of 15% of basic salary, up to ₹1 lakh per annum are tax-exempt.  
 
27. What is “National Pensions Scheme (NPS)”? 
 
"National Pension System" (NPS) means the contributory pension system whereby contributions from a 
subscriber are collected and accumulated in an individual pens ion account called PRAN using a system of 
points of presence, a central recordkeeping agency and pension funds as may be specified by regulations. 
NPS is a voluntary pension scheme, which is regulated by the Pension Fund Regulatory and development 
Authority. 
 
NPS is 100% Tax exempted. This being a Pension fund it can be withdrawn as per the Terms & Conditions of 
the Policy. For more details, please refer to “NPS Policy”. 
 
Note - 10% of Basic Salary for old tax regime, 10% or 14% for new tax regime.  
 
28. What are the tax benefits of NPS?   
The contribution made by the employee himself to the NPS Scheme would be allowed as a deduction under 
section 80CCD(1) and the contribution made by  the employer to the NPS Scheme would be allowed as a 
deduction under Section 80CCD(2). 
In case any employer contributes to the NPS Scheme on behalf of the employee and the benefit of the same 
would be availed by the employee which is to extend to 10% of B asic Salary., the employee would also be 
allowed a deduction under Section 80CCD(2) for the amount of contribution made by the employer.  
In recent budget under new sub-section 1B has also been introduced so as to provide for additional deduction 
in respect of any amount paid, of up to INR 50,000 for contributions made by any Individual assesses under 
NPS. This additional benefit of Rs. 50,000 is over and above the benefit of INR 1.5 Lacs allowed to be claimed 
as a deduction under Section 80C. Therefore, now the total deduction that can be claimed under Section 80C 
+ Section 80CCD = INR 2 Lacs. 
29. What are the tax benefits of NPS?   
 
The contribution made by the employee himself to the NPS Scheme would be allowed as a deduction under 
section 80CCD (1) and the contribution made by the employer to the NPS Scheme would be allowed as a 
deduction under Section 80CCD (2). 
Corporate NPS (under section 80CCD (2)) 
Employer contribution to NPS Scheme on behalf of employee is allowed at 10% of Basic Salary.  
o Employee selecting NPS through Empower+ / Peoplestrong will get the 10% of basic salary 
deduction and same shall get credited to their PRAN account provided by NSDL.

__data__.text:
Page 14 of 15 
 
Fixed Components 
1. What is “Basic Salary”? 
 
“Basic Salary” is a fixed component in your salary, which is 30% of Total Fixed Cost across all career levels 
except for few Officer / Executive levels in line with minimum wages act. This component is a part of monthly 
pay. 
 
2. What is “Supplementary Allowance”? 
 
“Supplementary Allowance” is a balancing amount post adjustment of all Fixed Components , Retirals and 
Flexi Pay. If any employee opts for Flexi Pay components, an equal amount will be adjusted from the 
“Supplementary Allowance”.  Minimum INR 1200 per annum is the limit for Supplementary allowance, 
which means post selection of Flexi Pay components at least INR 1200 per annum should be allocated in 
Supplementary allowance. 
 
3. What is “Statutory Bonus”? 
Statutory Bonus is applicable for employees whose Basic Salary is less than or equal INR 120000 per annum 
are eligible for a fixed bonus amount of INR 3500 per annum. This component is a part of monthly pay. 
 
Retiral Components 
1. What is “Provident Fund”? 
“Provident Fund” is a retiral benefit. 12% of the Basic Salary  or minimum contribution is Rs. 1800/ - 
contributed towards this fund as Employee’s contribution & equal contribution is done from Employer’s end 
as Employer’s Contribution to PF. This amount is 100% exempted from Tax.  
 
2. What is “Gratuity”? 
“Gratuity” is a monetary benefit paid as gratitude towards continuity of services. Employees who have 
served minimum 5 years of continuous services  are eligible for the same . Gratuity amount upto INR 20 Lac 
is 100% exempted from Tax. 
 
IMPORTANT NOTE:  
 
- Once you have opted for any Flexi Pay Component you can discontinue the same only in the 
next financial year.  
- Discontinuation of any component during the year for any reason will not be accepted.  
- In case you wish to add more Flexi Pay Components before declaring your investments, you 
may do the same when the window is opened during the month of December every year.  
- Flexi Components shall be considered as a Taxable or Non-Taxable as per Income Tax Act & 
subject to amendment from time to time by respective authority.

__data__.text: Frequently Asked Question - FAQ What is a Form 16? A Form 16 is a certificate issued to salaried individuals from their employer when he deducts tax from the employee salary. In simple words, it is an acknowledgement which states your deducted tax has been deposited with the income tax department. Form 16 is an important document that is issued in accordance with the provisions of Income Tax Act,1961. A form 16 contains details of the amount of tax deducted at source (TDS) on salary by your employer along with the salary breakup for the financial year. In a nutshell, it could be said that a Form 16 is a certificate of proof of the TDS deducted & deposited by your employer. How to download Form 16 from Empower+ (Web portal / Mobile) ? You can view Form 16 available at Empower+ portal (Web / Mobile) as follows: Empower+ Web portal:  Payroll Tab > Payroll > My Slip > Form 16 > View / Download

metadata.file_name: Frequently Asked Question_Form16_FY 2024 - 25.pdf
Frequently Asked Question_Form16_FY 2024 - 25.pdf

__data__.text: Also, you can access Form 16 from Mobile application  Login on Empower+ Mobile Application > Payroll Tab > Select Slip = Form 16 > Select Year > View and Click on Download form 16

Frequently Asked Question_Form16_FY 2024 - 25.pdf

__data__.text:
Once you download Form 16 you can simply share Form 16 on your personal email ID. (Newly joined employees will be able to view only completed FY Form-16 or Form-16 from their date of joining). Why do I need Form 16? Form 16 is a very important document as it:  Serves as a proof that government has received the tax deducted by your employer.  It assists in the process of filing your income tax return with the Income Tax Department.  Many banks and financial institutions demand Form 16 for verification of the person’s credentials while applying for loans. How to understand Form 16? Understanding & learning how to fill form 16 is very simple. It is divided into two sections- Part A and Part B.  Part A: This part of Form 16 is issued by the government. It shows quarter-wise details of your tax deposited with the government. The details mentioned in Part A are as follows: 
  Part B: This part shows the detailed computation of Income, on the basis of which tax is being calculated and deducted by your employer. It contains the breakup of the salary earned by you, various deductions, exemptions (if any) and the tax computation after considering all the items based on current tax slab rates. The details mentioned in Part B are as follows: 1. Amount of Gross Salary (1) 2. Exemptions and Allowances Considered (2) 3. Deduction - Entertainment Allowance and Tax on Employment (3) 4. Income chargeable under the head Salary (4) 5. Any Other Income reported by employee(5)

Frequently Asked Question_Form16_FY 2024 - 25.pdf

6. Gross Total Income (6) 7. Deductions under Chapter VI-A(80C, 80D, 80E etc) (7) 8. Total Income (8) 9. Tax on Total Income (9) 10. Education Cess (10) 11. Tax Payable (11) 12. Relief under section 89, if any. (12) 13. Tax Payable (13) 14. Verification of the above mentioned details by the employer.  
 In case, you are wondering how your Form 16 is prepared, here’s a brief of how things happen: Critical points to be checked in Form 16 The following critical points should be checked while submitting Income TAX returns to Income Tax authority to avoid any rejection from their end.  PAN No – Ensure PAN is correct.   Personal Details – Name & Other details   Total Tax (TDS) paid in Form No.16 (Par A) and Form No. 26AS as per March payslip

metadata.file_name: Frequently Asked Question_Form16_FY 2024 - 25.pdf
Frequently Asked Question_Form16_FY 2024 - 25.pdf

__data__.text: How do I correct my Personal Details on Form 16 such as Name / Address etc.? Your name & address in Form-16 is as per the details mentioned by you while applying your PAN which can be changed neither by employer nor payroll vendor.  In case of any change required to be done in your name or address, you are required to apply the  correction in PAN database by logging on to PAN Card Application (nsdl.com) How do get Form 16? Form 16 is issued by your employer and you can expect it by the end of June/July. But if it is not issued by the end of June, then you may demand it from your employer.  I lost my Form 16, what should I do? Form 16 is the most important document for you to file your income tax return and you should preserve this document carefully. But if you’ve lost it, do not panic, check your mail whether it has been emailed to you by your employer or not. If it’s not sent to you on your email, then you can simply request your employer to issue a copy of Form 16. You can also file the returns basis on TDS working (March 22 Payslip / FFS calculation) provided by employer.  Is Income Tax Return and Form 16 same? No, a Form 16 is not equivalent to an Income Tax Return but it’s the source document for your salary income. It is really helpful, especially in case your entire income is from salaries and there is no other source of income. Further, you don’t need to attach your Form 16 with your income tax return. Watch Video of ITR Filing :  Home | Income Tax Department / https://youtu.be/RiNU4UR0Evg  I haven’t received Form 16, how do I calculate my Salary Income? If you haven’t received a Form 16, then for the purpose of return filing, you will have to refer to your salary payslips, bank statements, tax-saving investment proofs, home and education loan certificates and Form 26AS etc for filing income tax return. While payslips contain details of your income like basic salary and allowances, Form 26AS contains the details of all your tax deducted and tax paid. The Form 26 AS can be viewed / downloaded from the Income Tax Department’s online portal which helps you to address all your TDS queries and linking AADHAR etc.  https://www.incometax.gov.in/iec/foportal/     For example, Ms. Tania was working with XYZ Ltd. and she didn’t receive any Form 16. In such a case, she consulted experts and they calculated the income on the basis of her monthly payslips which showed a basic

metadata.file_name: Frequently Asked Question_Form16_FY 2024 - 25.pdf
Frequently Asked Question_Form16_FY 2024 - 25.pdf

__data__.text: salary of Rs. 30,000 per month. Further, she had her home loan certificate, because of which she was allowed a deduction of Rs. 50,000 from her income. Hence, the final calculated income of Ms. Tania would be calculated as follows: Basic Salary = 30,000 x 12 months = 3,60,000 Hence, the Taxable Income [after deducting the basic exemption limit] of Ms. Tania will be Rs. 60,000 (3,60,000 – 2,50,000 (basic exemption) – 50,000 deduction for home loan). I want to claim a deduction under Chapter VI / other exemptions / allowances in my income tax return which is not in my Form 16? Can I do it? In a case where your employer issues you a Form 16 without any deductions, you can still claim the deduction in your income tax return. Form 16 is just a certificate issued by your employer which certifies deduction of tax (TDS) on your salary. It’s just a base document for return filing and not the final return itself. You can always take the benefit of the deductions you are eligible for, while filing your income tax return even if the same are not mentioned in your Form 16. Our experts say “Always remember to check whether the House Rent Allowance exemption has been taken in Form 16 or not (if you’re entitled to it). It is usually either not reflected or calculated at a wrong value especially in the case of multiple employers during the year. In such an event, you yourself can calculate it and take the exemption of same while filing your income tax return.” Trouble filing your income tax return? Just click here! My Form 16 is incorrect, what should I do? In case, where a Form 16 is duly issued but with a mistake, then the same can be rectified by your employer on your request. Kindly highlight the same to respective zonal HR. Subsequently, a revised Form 16 will be issued to you by TALIC. Is Form 26AS different from Form 16? Form 26AS Form 16 Contains details of tax deducted at source (TDS) for all the heads of income. Contains details of tax deducted at source (TDS) for the income from salary only. The details of other heads of income can also be provided in your Form16, in case you have provided the details of other income to your employer. Provided on the Department’s site based on data submitted by all the employer and employee.   Issued by your employer to you.  I switched my job during the year, how should I file my return now? It is very much possible for you to change your job in the middle of the year, but then you may be wondering who will issue Form 16. In case, you had two employers for the year, you will get Form 16 from both the employers for the respective months served by you. The income tax return will be filed by combining the details of both the Form 16s. But you must be careful in doing so because it might happen that both your former and present employer has calculated your tax after taking into the consideration the basic exemption limit. In such a case, you are not entitled to take the benefit of exemption limit twice, but only once. The same applies to all deductions and allowances during the year, as any deduction / allowance can be claimed only once or as per the respective rules of the income tax law even if it is reflected in both the Form 16’s.

metadata.file_name: Frequently Asked Question_Form16_FY 2024 - 25.pdf
Frequently Asked Question_Form16_FY 2024 - 25.pdf

__data__.text: For example, let’s say, in the last year, you worked with a company X Pvt. Ltd. for a period of 6 months for a salary of Rs. 45,000 per month and for the rest 6 months you joined Y Ltd. for Rs. 50,000 per month. In such a case, you draw a salary of Rs. 2,70,000 from X Pvt. Ltd. and Rs. 3,00,000 from Y Ltd. Now, both the companies X Pvt. Ltd. and Y Ltd. will deduct your tax after consideration of the basic exemption limit (i.e. Rs. 2,50,000/-) only and your Form 16 will be based on the same. This means X Pvt. Ltd. will charge tax on the balance Rs. 20,000 and Y Ltd. will charge tax on Rs. 50,000, each giving you an exemption of Rs. 2,50,000. But, at the time of filing your final return for the year, you will be allowed the basic exemption only once and not twice i.e. your tax should be charged on Rs. 3,30,000. (Rs. 300000 + 270000 – 250000). Further, when you switch jobs in a year, then you should furnish your previous employer’s TDS details to your new employer in Form 12B. Will I get Form 16 from my employer even if there is no TDS? Form 16 is a TDS certificate & it is issued only when there is tax deducted. Therefore, if there is no tax deducted, employer is not required to issue Form 16 to you. Purpose of form 16 is to serve as a proof of tax deducted & deposited on your behalf. When Form 16 is required? What is importance of Form 16? Form 16 is required when you are filing your income tax return. This form serves as a proof that your employer has deducted & deposited tax from your salary with income tax department in your name. What is Income from salary? How it is related to my Form 16? Any amount received from your employer during employment period is called Salary. Usually it comprises of basic salary, allowances, bonus, pension, wages, or any other benefit given in relation to your employment.  When employer deducts tax from your salary, he issues Form 16 to you. This form is an acknowledgement from your employer that he has deducted tax from your salary. I have received arrear and/or advance salary income. Will my employer consider relief u/s 89 to calculate TDS on salary? Yes, your employer is required to consider Sec 89 of Income Tax Act for calculation purposes in case you receive any arrears or advance salary income. Refer our blog for detailed information on sec 89.  What is Digital Signature? A digital Signature authenticates electronic documents in a similar manner a handwritten signature authenticates printed documents. Refer our guidelines PPT’s for authenticate signature on form 16. Activate the DSC, Download the form 16 on local desktop and then follow process of digital signature validation.  Digital signature validity? Please note that the digital signature is valid for 3 years (validity mention in form 16) and hence we recommend that a printout of the authenticated Form-16 copy is retained with you for future use and reference.  How to validate the digital signature? It is important to validate digital signature of issued Form-16. Digital signature exists at bottom of every page. To check validity / authenticity of digital signature, please download your Form 16 on your local drive and follow the signature validation process as described hereunder.

Financial Year 2025-26

metadata.file_name: Investment Guidelines 2025-26-Updated.pdf
Investment Guidelines 2025-26-Updated.pdf

__data__.text:
Old and New Regime of Tax: 
 
At the time of making the investment declaration the employees are given an option to choose the tax regime. Based 
on the tax regime opted by them their taxes are calculated and deduced during the year.  
 
As per the CBDT circular number 04 of 2023 dated April 05, 2023. It was clarified that the tax regime once opted by 
an employee cannot be changed during the Financial Year. However, if an employee wants to change the tax regime, 
he/she may do so at the time of filing of their personal income tax return. 
 
Therefore, the employees who opted for the new regime of the tax under section 115BAC of the Income Tax Act, 
would not be getting any benefit for the investments done by them. And hence such employees are not required to 
submit any proof of investments. 
 
While the employees who opt for the old tax regime will continue getting the benefits of the various investments 
done by them, as they had been doing till now in the previous year(s). The detailed section-wise guidelines given 
below will help in understanding the requirement of documents to be submitted to get proper benefits of the 
investment done by them. 
 
                         
Default tax regime if regime /investment declaration not submitted by employee: - 
 
New tax regime is the default regime: The ministry of finance has made the new income tax regime the 
DEFAULT effective from the Financial Year 2023-24. However, employees still have the option to choose the old 
tax regime, but they will now have to specifically indicate this preference to the employer by selecting and 
submitting in during Investment Declaration.  
Under the new tax regime, Employee is not allowed to claim all the traditional allowances / deductions such as 
HRA, LTA, Interest paid on housing loan, payment made for Mediclaim insurance, etc.

__data__.text:
Tax Exemptions / Deductions allowed under Old Tax Regime: 
(Proof required at the end of FY i.e. Dec 25 to Mar-26) 
 
                             
  
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
House Rent Allowance 
                  (HRA) 
 
House Rent Allowance (HRA) 
 
 
To claim exemption against HRA, an employee needs to p rovide the rent receipt. 
 Rent receipt is mandatory to submit in case mode of payment is cash.  
 Rent receipt can be submitted for monthly or quarterly rent amount.  
o Monthly Rent Receipt – One Rent Receipt for each month  
OR 
o Quarterly Rent Receipt - One rent receipt for each quarter i.e. April to June (one 
receipt), July – September (one receipt), October – December (one receipt) and 
January to March (one receipt). 
 In case of online payment, the bank statement of the bank from which rent has been 
paid and highlight the transactions with the name of the landlord needs to be 
furnished. This needs to be submitted along with certain documents, such as electricity 
bill etc. to prove the name of the landlord.  
 Self-Declaration is acceptable for rent amounting up to 3000/ - per month. 
 Rent receipts must contain following details.  
o Name of the tenant  
o Name of the landlord  
o PAN of landlord (Mandatory if monthly rent is > Rs 8333/ -) 
o Address of the property  
o Amount of monthly or quarterly rent  
o Month(s) for which rent has been paid  
o Receiver’s (i.e. Landlord) signature on the revenue stamp. (Revenue stamp is 
not required for the employees paying rent in Karnataka State)  
 
 
Monthly rent paid amount should be mentioned clearly on the rent receipt to avoid any 
confusion during the validation of actual documents. 
 
Receipt should be in readable format and all information mentioned should be clearly visible.  
 
Note: - 
 If the rent amount is more than Rs. 8,333/ - per month (Rs. 1,00,000/ - per year) and 
claiming HRA benefit, it is mandatory to furnish Permanent Account Number (PAN) of 
the landlord is mandatory.  
 
 In case employee is paying rent amount which exceeds Rs.50000 every month to a 
resident Indian, Individuals to deduct tax (TDS) at 2% of the rent. This amendment has 
come into effect from the 1st June, 2017.  
 Furnish a copy of Form 16C (if issued to landlor d during FY 2024-25) or declaration in 
the attached format confirming that Form 16C shall be issued in due course.  
 
Please note that only those expenditure gets qualified for exemption from income -tax on which 
payment of rent has actually been incurred in respect of residential accommodation occupied by 
the assessee. 
 
Thus, house rent allowance which is granted to an employee who is residing in a house/flat 
owned by him/spouse, is not exempted from income-tax.

DEDUCTIONS UNDER SECTION CHAPTER VIA 
 
 
Section 
 
Details 
Proof Required 
 
U/S 80D –  
MEDICAL 
INSURANCE 
PREMIUM 
 Deduction u/s 80D is allowed against premium paid for 
Mediclaim policy: 
- Individual Policy can be in the name of taxpayer, spouse, 
parents, or dependent children.  
- HUF (Hindu Undivided Family)  policy can be taken for 
any member of the family and it is allowed as deduction  
at HUF only.  
 Maximum Limit for Deduction: 
- Deduction up to Rs. 25,000/- is allowed when policy is 
taken for self, spouse & dependent children 
- Additional deduction up to Rs. 25000/- is allowed when the 
policy is taken for parents of the taxpayer whether 
dependent or not. 
- In case Taxpayer/Spouse or Parents are Senior Citizens 
(i.e., residents of India with 60 years or more of age), 
deduction is allowed up to Rs. 50000/- for both taxpayer 
and the parents instead of up to Rs 25000/-, as 
mentioned in both above cases.  
 Deduction is allowed against premium paid for current financial 
year only. 
- If the premium payment due date is after the cut-off date, 
then last year’s receipt needs to be submitted. Basis the 
last year’s receipt, the benefit will be provided.  
 Only Self / spouse /children and parent’s proof(s) is/are to 
be provided and age is to be specified in the proofs. 
 Medical expenses on the health of a person who is a 
senior citizen can be claimed if the Mediclaim insurance  
premium is not paid on the health of such person.  
 Late fees or any other penalties are not allowed as per IT Act, 
hence, it will not be considered as deduction. 
 Premium payment mode or the payment of medical expenditure 
should be other than cash (exception only in case of preventive 
health checkup). 
 Preventive Health checkup benefits will be allowed for an 
amount maximum up- to Rs.5,000/-, the maximum limit 
within section 80D. 
 Premium paid against In-laws insurance policy shall not be 
allowed for tax exemption. 
 Note:  
1. Taxpayers need to ensure to neither enter any “Mediclaim 
Premium amount” nor upload any document in case Mediclaim 
insurance premium is deducted from salary under Parental 
Insurance. 
 
2. Amount deducted towards In -laws parents should be 
excluded as the same is not allowed for tax benefit / 
deduction .

medical bills

__data__.text:
Section Details Proof Required 
 
 
U/S 80E – 
REPAYMENT OF 
INTEREST ON 
EDUCATION LOAN 
 
 Benefit is available only to an individual assessee for the  
interest amount paid on education loan taken for the full-time 
higher education of self, spouse or children or the student for 
whom the individual is a legal guardian.  
 The loan should be taken from any bank / financial institution or 
any approved charitable institution. Loans taken from friends or 
relatives do not qualify for the deduction. 
Educational loans are considered irrespective of the place of study 
(within or outside India). Higher studies include all the fields of 
study pursued after passing senior secondary examination or its 
equivalent exam. It includes both the Vocational courses as well as 
the regular courses. 
 The deduction for the interest on loan starts from the year in 
which assessee starts repaying the loan. The benefit is available 
only for 8 years starting from the year in which assessee 
starts repaying the loan or until the interest is fully repaid, 
whichever is earlier. It means if entire payments are done in 5 
years only, then tax deduction will be allowed for 5 years and not 
8 years. 
 Any Part time or correspondence courses are not considered as a 
part of deductions. 
 THERE IS NO TAX BENEFIT FOR THE PRINCIPAL PART OF EMI. 
 
 Certificate of payment 
from bank 
 / Financial Institution 
mentioning amount of 
interest paid during the 
financial year.  
 
 
 
  
 
80EE – Income Tax 
Benefits on Interest 
on 
Home Loan (First 
Time 
Buyers) 
 
This scheme was introduced for financial year 2013-14 and was 
available for 2 years, FY 2013-14 and FY 2014-15 only (assessment 
year 2014-15 and 2015-16). This was initially available for up to Rs. 
1,00,000 per year only. 
 
However, this section has been reintroduced effective FY 2016-17 
(AY 2017-18).  Therefore, deduction of Rs. 50,000 per year is 
allowed on interest amounting as per the following conditions: 
 
- The benefit of tax deduction available till the loan is fully 
repaid. 
- The benefit is available on or above Rs. 2,00,000 as allowed 
u/s 24(b). 
 
Following conditions should be satisfied. 
1. Loan should be sanctioned between 1st Apr’16 to 31st Mar’17. 
2. The amount of loan sanctioned for residential house property 
should not exceed Rs. 35,00,000/-. 
3. The value of residential house property should not exceed 
Rs.50,00,000/-. 
4. The assessee should not own any house property on the date of 
sanction of loan. 
 
 
 
 
sanction of loan. 
 
1. Certificate of payment 
from bank /Institution 
mentioning amount of 
principal & interest paid 
during the financial 
year. 
 
2. Declaration to the effect 
that the employee does 
not own any other 
house property on the 
date of sanction of loan. 
 
3. Copy of 
registration/Sale deed 
of house mentioning the 
value of property. 
 
4. Copy of loan sanction 
letter, to determine the 
loan sanction date.

__data__.text:
Section Details Proof Required 
 
 
80DD – Maintenance / 
Medical 
Treatment of 
Handicapped 
Dependents 
 
 Deduction is allowed for a dependent of the taxpayer 
and not the taxpayer himself/herself. 
 
 The taxpayer is not allowed this deduction if the 
dependent has claimed a deduction in under section 
80U for himself/herself. 
 
1. Dependent, in case of an individual taxpayer, means 
spouse, children, parents, brothers & sisters of the 
taxpayer. In case of an HUF, it means a member of the 
HUF. 
 
2. The taxpayer can claim the benefit if the taxpayer has 
incurred expenses for medical treatment (including 
nursing), training & rehabilitation of the differently 
abled dependent or the taxpayer may have deposited in 
a scheme of LIC or another insurer for maintenance of 
the dependent. 
 
3. Disability of the dependent should not be less than 40% 
4.  
 
5. Disability is as defined under section 2(i) of the 
Persons of Disabilities Act, 1995 
 
If the above conditions are met, amount of 
deduction allowed is – 
 
 In case of a person with severe disability (above 40% 
but less than 80%) the amount of deduction is fixed at 
Rs. 75,000/-, irrespective of actual expenditure. 
 
 In case of a person with severe disability (over 80%) a 
higher deduction of Rs.1,25,000 is fixed, irrespective of 
actual expenditure.  
 
1. Certificate issued by a physician, 
surgeon, oculist, or a psychiatrist 
working in a hospital or institution 
specified by appropriate 
government for the purpose of the 
Persons with Disabilities (Equal 
Opportunities, Protection of Rights 
and Full Participation) Act 1995 
 
2. Form-10 IA duly signed & stamped 
for the current fin-year 25-26 by 
the doctor & counter signed & 
stamped by Medical 
Superintendent/CMO/Head of the 
Hospital  
 
3. Where condition of disability 
require reassessment, fresh 
certificate to be obtained after its 
expiry to continue claiming the 
deduction. 
 
4. Declaration from dependent for 
not claiming benefit u/s 80U.

__data__.text:
Section Details Proof Required 
 
 
SEC-80DDB - 
DEDUCTION IN 
RESPECT OF 
MEDICAL 
TREATMENT 
 
Deductions of expenses on medical treatment of specified 
ailments (such as AIDS, cancer, and neurological diseases) can 
be claimed under Section 80DDB. The maximum amount of 
deduction allowed from gross total income is basis the 
condition that no medical reimbursement is received from any 
insurance any or employer for this amount. In case of 
reimbursement, the amount paid should be reduced by the 
amount received if any under insurance from an insurer or 
reimbursed by an employer. 
 
For this section, in the case of an employee “dependent”  
means individual, the spouse, children, parents, brothers, and 
sisters of the employee or any of them, dependent wholly or 
mainly on the employee for his support and maintenance. 
 
Amount of Deduction 
 
If age is less than 60 years, then the amount of deduction 
would be actual amount spent or Rs. 40,000/-, whichever is 
lower.  
 
If age is 60 years or more, then amount of deduction would be 
actual medical expenses or Rs. 100,000/-, whichever is lower. 
 
Following is the list of specified diseases and ailments for 
deduction under section 80DDB: 
(a) Neurological diseases 
(b) Dementia 
(c) Dystonia Musculorum Deformans 
(d) Motor Neuron Disease 
(e) Ataxia 
(f) Chorea 
(g) Hemiballismus 
(h) Aphasia 
(i) Parkinson’s Disease 
(j)Malignant Cancer 
(k) Full Blown AIDS 
(l) Chronic Renal failure 
(m) Hematological Disorder (a) Hemophilia & (b) 
Thalassaemia

disease issued by –

Doctor of Medicine 
(DM) in Neurology((a) 
to (i))

general medicine (k)

DM in Nephrology or 
Urologist having 
Masters in Urology

in Hematology  
 
2. Copy of medical bills for the 
expenses incurred on 
treatment of such dependent.

by the employee for any 
future reference/audit 
purpose.

year.

__data__.text:
Ease in claiming credit for TCS collected/TDS deducted by salaried 
employees 
 
Employees having income (other than salary) and/or TDS/TCS (Tax Deducted at Source or Tax Collected at Source) by the other person 
or organization, can now declare to the employer to avail the benefit of TD/TCS. This information is to be furnished in the prescribed format. 
This rule is subject to the following condition. 
 The above provision shall not have the effect of reducing the tax deductible except where loss from house property is reported. 
 
TCS vs TDS 
 Tax Deducted at Source (TDS): Typically applies to salary income, interest income, or other forms of earnings that 
are taxable. The employer deducts TDS from the employee’s salary and remits it to the government. Form 16 A will 
be issued by the diductor of tax as evidence to claim the tax credits. 
 Tax Collected at Source (TCS): Primarily applies to transactions involving the sale of goods or services and is 
collected by the seller/service provider. For an employee, TCS would be relevant only if they engage in such specified 
transactions. Form 27D will be issued by the collector of tax as evidence to claim the tax credits. 
 
PREVIOUS EMPLOYER SALARY 
 
Employee who has joined the any during the financial year 2025 – 2026, i.e. after April 01,2025 also needs to give 
the details of salary received from his previous employer in the Form 12B along with certified Final Tax utation 
sheet/ Tax Certificate for FY 2025-26 issued by the previous employer so that correct tax can be deducted 
accordingly. 
 
Even if an employee has already submitted proof of investment to their previous employer and received 
tax benefits, it is mandatory to submit all relevant proof of investment (excluding rent receipts from the 
previous employer's tenure) to the current employer to receive tax benefits on such investments. If 
proof of investment has been submitted only to the previous employer and not to the current employer, 
the current employer will not extend tax benefits for such investments, which may result in additional 
tax deductions. 
 
 Note: -   Previous employer income needs to be submitted on ESS Portal under “PREVIOUS EMPLOYER” Tab 
 of Investment Proof Submission page.

metadata.file_name: New Superannuation Scheme_F&Q.pdf
New Superannuation Scheme_F&Q.pdf

__data__.text:
NEW SUPERANNUATION SCHEME – (FAQ) 
1. What is the New Superannuation Scheme? 
o The New Superannuation Scheme is a retirement benefit plan designed to provide 
financial security to the employee post-retirement. 
2. Who is eligible to join the New Superannuation Scheme? 
o All on -roll employees of Tata AIA Life Insurance Co. Ltd. who hold the position of 
Manager or above are eligible to enrol in the New Superannuation Scheme. 
3. How can an employee enrol in the scheme? 
o An Employee can enrol in the scheme through PeopleStrong System under the Flexi 
Plan. 
4. What is the yearly contribution rate for the New Superannuation Scheme? 
o The yearly contribution rate is 15% of the basic salary, with a maximum limit of ₹1 
lakh. 
5. Will an employee receive income tax benefits if they opt for the Superannuation Scheme? 
o Yes, employees will receive income tax benefits under both the old and new tax 
regimes. The contributions made by the employer to the Superannuation Scheme are 
considered employer contributions, which help reduce the employee's gross taxable 
income. Employer contributions up to INR 1 lakh per annum are tax-exempt. 
6. How does a superannuation scheme work? 
o Individuals contribute a portion of their income to their superannuation fund, which 
is then invested in various assets such as stocks, bonds, and property. Over a period, 
these investments grow, providing a source of income in retirement. 
7. Why is it important to have a superannuation scheme? 
o A superannuation scheme helps individuals save for retirement, ensuring financial 
security and independence during their non-working years. 
8. What are the benefits of contributing to a superannuation scheme? 
o Contributing to a superannuation scheme allows individuals to accumulate savings 
over their working years, benefit from potential tax advantages, and ultimately enjoy 
a comfortable retirement. 
9. What happens to the funds of existing employees in the old Superannuation Scheme? 
o The funds of existing employees will be transferred to the New Superannuation 
Scheme.

metadata.file_name: New Superannuation Scheme_F&Q.pdf
New Superannuation Scheme_F&Q.pdf

__data__.text:
10. Are existing employees have been automatically moved to the New Superannuation 
Scheme? 
o Yes, existing employees who are part of the old Superannuation Scheme have been 
already part of the New Superannuation Scheme by default. 
11. Can I opt out of the New Superannuation Scheme once I have joined? 
o No, once you have opted into the New Superannuation Scheme, you cannot opt out. 
12. How can I track my contributions to the New Superannuation Scheme? 
o You will receive a statement on a quarterly basis from the HR Compensation & Benefit 
team. 
13. What happens to my contributions if I leave the company before retirement? 
o Your fund will remain with us till retirement or 
o You can shift to new employer, if they have an approved superannuation scheme  
which has power to except such transfer or 
o In case of ill-health or incapacitation or if he retired from service 10 year before normal 
retirement age, the pension as may be elected by him, will become payable 
immediately. Alternatively, member may elect to defer elect of receipt of pension until 
retirement date. Any death during the deferment period, beneficiary will start getting 
pension on immediate basis. 
14. How can I withdraw funds from the New Superannuation Scheme post-retirement? 
o You can withdraw one-third (if tenure is 5 years or more) or half (if tenure is less than 
5 years) of the total fund value, with a 31.2% TDS applied to the withdrawal amount. 
The remaining fund can be invested in an annuity scheme with TATA AIA (minimum 
age 45 years) or any other annuity scheme provider. 
15. How is the fund managed in the New Superannuation Scheme? 
o The new superannuation scheme is Unit linked with a default option of 10% equity 
and 90% Debt. You may choose to switch investment option any time by writing to HR 
Compensation and Benefit team.

17. Can I change my investment options in the New Superannuation Scheme? 
o Yes, you can switch to different fund option as per your need and risk appetite. 
18. What are the fund management charges for these investment options? 
o The fund management charges range per annum from 0.30% to 1.35%, 
depending on the total fund available under management. 
19. What happens to my superannuation fund if I pass away before retirement? 
o Nominee will start getting pension or they can withdraw the money subject to tax 
applicability. 
20. Can my beneficiaries access my superannuation fund if I pass away? 
o Yes, as per scheme rule. 
21. Can I transfer my superannuation fund to another scheme or provider? 
o Yes, you can transfer your superannuation fund only to another scheme or provider if 
your new organisation offers superannuation benefit to their employees  and have a 
power to except such transfer.

metadata.file_name: New Superannuation Scheme_F&Q.pdf
New Superannuation Scheme_F&Q.pdf

__data__.text:
22. What documentation is required to join the New Superannuation Scheme? 
o Employee will not require any document to join the New Superannuation Scheme. 
23. What is the process for nominating a beneficiary? 
o You can nominate a beneficiary by filling out a nomination form and submitting it to 
the HR Department as per scheme rule. 
24. Can I nominate more than one beneficiary for my superannuation fund? 
o Yes, an employee can nominate multiple beneficiaries for their superannuation fund 
according to the scheme rules. For example, an employee can designate 50% to their 
daughter and 50% to their spouse. 
 
25. What happens if I do not nominate a beneficiary? 
o In case of such scenario, on event of death, the money will be paid to legal heir 
appointed by court of law, as per the scheme rule. 
26. What is the minimum age for retirement under the New Superannuation Scheme? 
o The minimum retirement age is typically 60 years, but this may vary based on the 
scheme’s rules. 
27. What are the investment risks associated with the New Superannuation Scheme? 
o Investment risks include market volatility, interest rate changes, and economic factors 
that may affect fund performance. There is no capital guarantee for this scheme. 
28. Can I switch between different investment options? 
o Yes, you can switch between different fund option available with us. 12 free switches 
are allowed in a year. 
29. Do the Trust managed In-House? 
o Yes, Superannuation Trust scheme will be managed In -House i.e by TATA AIA Life 
Insurance Company Limited. 
30. Can I get a loan against my superannuation fund? 
o No, loans against the superannuation fund are not permitted under the scheme’s 
rules. 
31. Who should I contact for the New Superannuation Scheme?

metadata.file_name: Optional Holiday _ FAQ - Updated 30 December 2024.pdf
Optional Holiday _ FAQ - Updated 30 December 2024.pdf

__data__.text:
Frequently Asked Questions  
 
1. What is “Optional Holiday”?  
 
Ans: Holidays listed by Government of India for the calendar year (Jan to Dec), but is not given as a declared Holiday 
in TALIC’s Holiday calendar for regions (States) respectively, is Optional Holiday.  
 
 
2. Who is eligible for “Optional Holiday”?  
Ans: All TALIC employees are eligible for “Optional Holiday”.  
 
 
3. What is the benefit of “Optional Holiday”?  
Ans: Employees from any particular community whose festival is not listed as a declared holiday in his/her respective 
region’s holiday list can avail benefit of this feature. He/she can apply for an optional Holiday with their religion’s 
festival as against any other Optional Holiday given in the Holiday list.  
 
 
4. How many “Optional Holiday” are available in a Calendar year?  
Ans: You can avail 2 Optional Holidays in a Calendar year.  
 
 
5. When can I apply for “Optional Holiday”?  
Ans: You can apply for “Optional Holiday” any time till 15 days prior to the Holiday. 
 
 
6. Do I need to inform my Supervisor before applying for “Optional Holiday”?  
Ans: Yes, you need to discuss with your supervisor before applying for “Optional Holiday” and obtain approval.  
 
 
7. How can I apply for optional Holiday?  
Ans: You need to apply for Optional Holiday from Darwinbox (HRMS). First you need to check the available optional 
holidays in your holiday calendar and apply for the desired Optional Holiday from the Holiday  List in Darwinbox. 
Every eligible employee will have 2 Optional Holiday in their annual quota.  
 
 
8. Can I apply for a back dated Optional holiday?  
 
Ans: Yes, you can apply for back dated Optional Holiday but within 90 days only.

metadata.file_name: Optional Holiday _ FAQ - Updated 30 December 2024.pdf
Optional Holiday _ FAQ - Updated 30 December 2024.pdf

__data__.text:
9. Can I Cancel/Withdraw “Optional Holiday” post approval received from Manager?  
 
Ans: Yes, You can withdraw the approved Optional Holiday from Darwinbox. For that you need to go to Time 
Management Module >> Leave >> Holiday List >> click on Revoke button against the approved Optional Holiday 
 
 
10. Withdrawing an approved Optional Holiday require the approval from L1 Manager?  
Ans: Yes. Once you submit the withdrawal application against an approved Optional Holiday. It will go to the L1 
Manager for approval.  
 
 
11. Is Auto approval is applicable on Optional Holiday?  
Ans: Yes. Auto approval feature is applicable on Optional Holiday as well. Any unactioned application will get auto 
approved post 5 days of the application  
 
 
12. How can I check the Optional Holiday balance?  
Ans : Go to the Time Management Module in Darwinbox and then click on leave and select Holiday List. The page 
will provide you the summary of all Leave balances including Optional Holiday.  
 
 
13. Can Optional Holiday balance can be carry forwarded to next year?  
Ans: No. Optional Holiday balance cannot be carry forwarded to next year. It has to be utilized in the same calendar 
year only (Jan – Dec). The unutilized balance will get lapsed.  
 
 
14. What in case I get transferred to any other Location?  
Ans: In case if you get transferred to any other location, you will have to contact your ZHR for reconfiguration of 
Holiday List only if the revised list is not available on Darwin Box.  
 
 
15. How will this be treated in case if resignation is applied post selecting/availing “Optional Holiday”?  
Ans: In case any employee resigns at any point of time post applying for “Optional Holiday”, the same will be taken 
care as against his/her eligibility of leaves/holidays.  
 
 
16. Where can I see my subordinate’s attendance details with respect to “Optional Holiday”?  
Ans: You are required to follow the same steps as it is followed in checking Attendance/Leave details in Darwinbox.

metadata.file_name: Optional Holiday _ FAQ - Updated 30 December 2024.pdf
Optional Holiday _ FAQ - Updated 30 December 2024.pdf

__data__.text:
17. Where can I “Approve” or “Deny" Leave application of my subordinates with relating to “Optional Holiday”?  
Ans: You are required to follow the same steps as it is followed in “Approving or Denying” Leave  &Attendance 
applications in Darwinbox.  
 
 
18. Will I get transport facility on the “Optional Holiday”?  
Ans: No, you will not receive any transport facility for working on “Optional Holiday”.  
 
 
19. Can I claim for travel / food expenses reimbursements for working on “Optional Holiday”?  
Ans: No, you cannot claim for travel / food expenses reimbursements for working on “Optional Holiday”. This will 
be treated as a normal working day. It is employee’s responsibility to ensure such claims are not raised & supervisor’s 
responsibility to ensure such claims are not approved.  
 
 
HR SPOC across your region standby for any further support/clarifications.  
 
 
Disclaimer: The misuse of the policy will be viewed as breach/violation of code of conduct of the company and may lead to action 
against employee which may also include termination of employment.

Tax Calculator User Manual 
 
By using this tax calculator, you can have the visibility to get a quick view of your annual tax liability 
toward Old Tax Regime V/s New Tax Regime, which will also be helpful in deciding which tax regime 
suits you the best. 
Gross Salary shown in tax calculator has computed basis on considering employee’s previous 
month’s actual salary which also include all variable payments paid in till previous month and 
applicable perks during the FY.  
Your actual Tax liability could be differ based on actual & additional variable payment and 
paydays, if applicable, which will be part of employee’s final respective month Payroll cycle. 
All employees are advised to check their tentative annual tax liability by using Tax Calculator 
before submitting their Investment submission for current FY. 
Use of Tax Calculator has described hereunder: 
Step 1: Access “Tax Calculator” in Payroll section on Employee Portal. 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
Step 2: The employee will be able to see different sections under which taxes exemptions are provided. 
Employee has to enter details in each section by clicking on down arrow of each to finally check the 
taxable amount under old and new regime.
